entry.def: If you describe someone as gauche, you mean that they are awkward and uncomfortable in the company of other people.

example.ex: We're all a bit gauche when we're young...
example.tran: 年轻的时候我们都有点放不开。

example.ex: She was a rather gauche, provincial creature.
example.tran: 她是个非常不善交际、偏狭守旧的人。

sentences.sentence: "too gauche to leave the room when the conversation became intimate"
"their excellent manners always may be feel gauche"

auth_sentence.content: His illustrator scarcely ever achieves anything that is not gauche and lifeless.
auth_sentence.res_content: His illustrator scarcely ever achieves anything that is not gauche and lifeless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His illustrator scarcely ever achieves anything that is not gauche and lifeless.

auth_sentence.content: Several middle-aged women were pulling reluctant, gauche teenage girls off the pavement.
auth_sentence.res_content: Several middle-aged women were pulling reluctant, gauche teenage girls off the pavement.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Several middle-aged women were pulling reluctant, gauche teenage girls off the pavement.

auth_sentence.content: Eva was a rather sweet, gentle person but socially gauche, uncomfortable.
auth_sentence.res_content: Eva was a rather sweet, gentle person but socially gauche, uncomfortable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Eva was a rather sweet, gentle person but socially gauche, uncomfortable.
